Text: PERC index pricingIndex for pricing in the PERC contracts is based on the average of the spot price and the citygate price as follows Calculation of spot price C C AB Where A is the low and B is the high of the range as reported in the first publication of the billing month of Inside FERCs Gas Market Report for Chicago citygate Calculation of citygate price E E DC Where D is the price as reported in the first publication of the billing month of Natural Gas Week for Delivered to Utility Midwest Calculation of Contract Price F F E x applicable percentage

Re Revised PERC RFG documents attached heretoare the confirm documents for the PERC RFG transaction My suggested revisions are redlined I did not revise the Enfolio document but it needs to be changed from ENA to Enron MW LLC thanks Russell
Cc a revised draft of the QNT confirm Russell Murrell
QNT draft Cc hopefully the final draft of the QNT confirm Please provide comments and lets try to get this signed thanks Russell Murrell

QNT revisions with altcrediting Cc new draft with alternative language for Transportation Capacity Credit section Enron MW trading is not comfortable with the Gas Daily posting as the value determinant We would prefer to base the value on actual transactions I believe PGL already has audit rights Russell Murrell

PERC index pricingIndex for pricing in the PERC contracts is based on the average of the spot price and the citygate price as follows Calculation of spot price C C AB Where A is the low and B is the high of the range as reported in the first publication of the billing month of Inside FERCs Gas Market Report for Chicago citygate Calculation of citygate price E E DC Where D is the price as reported in the first publication of the billing month of Natural Gas Week for Delivered to Utility Midwest Calculation of Contract Price F F E x applicable percentage

Re Revised PERC RFG documents attached heretoare the confirm documents for the PERC RFG transaction My suggested revisions are redlined I did not revise the Enfolio document but it needs to be changed from ENA to Enron MW LLC thanks Russell

Re gas hedging pilot program in Ohio Cc Kerry I have already had preliminary discussions with DominionEast Ohio and NiSourceColumbia however I think your idea to get a meeting Schriber is excellent I would like to get all the Ohio utilities freedup to look at hedging programs so that ENA can provide risk management services Keep me posted and let me know if I can do anything for you Kerry Stroup AM To James D nron Roy ES Susan M nron Phil NRON Russell E nron Gil NRON Lisa nron cc Janine nron Richard nron Subject gas hedging pilot program in Ohio On Wednesday Ohio PUCO Chairman Alan Schriber revealed in testimony to the House Public Utilities Committee that the Commission is considering putting in place a pilot program for the coming heating season in which gas utilities could hedge gas cost exposure Subsequently I learned from the PUCO staff that Schriber had met with them the day before at which time staff advocated that hedging be facilitated I also learned that staff has been in discussions with East Ohio GasDominion on the same subject and that this was the impetus for staffs discussion with Schreiber Although the Commission has taken no formal action at this point staff contacts advise that something will likely take shape over the next several weeks and conceivably that other gas utilities may be involved In the meantime it may be expedient to meet with Chairman Schriber to position ourselves to take advantage of this opportunity by advocating a broad extension of the program to other gas utilities as well as programspecific features eg leveraging our weather derivative products If there is interest I would be happy to arrange a meeting with him And given Dominions interest we may wish to be in contact East Ohio Gas

Re gas hedging pilot program in Ohio Cc Kerry I have already had preliminary discussions with DominionEast Ohio and NiSourceColumbia however I think your idea to get a meeting Schriber is excellent I would like to get all the Ohio utilities freedup to look at hedging programs so that ENA can provide risk management services Keep me posted and let me know if I can do anything for you Kerry Stroup AM To James D nron Roy ES Susan M nron Phil NRON Russell E nron Gil NRON Lisa nron cc Janine nron Richard nron Subject gas hedging pilot program in Ohio On Wednesday Ohio PUCO Chairman Alan Schriber revealed in testimony to the House Public Utilities Committee that the Commission is considering putting in place a pilot program for the coming heating season in which gas utilities could hedge gas cost exposure Subsequently I learned from the PUCO staff that Schriber had met with them the day before at which time staff advocated that hedging be facilitated I also learned that staff has been in discussions with East Ohio GasDominion on the same subject and that this was the impetus for staffs discussion with Schreiber Although the Commission has taken no formal action at this point staff contacts advise that something will likely take shape over the next several weeks and conceivably that other gas utilities may be involved In the meantime it may be expedient to meet with Chairman Schriber to position ourselves to take advantage of this opportunity by advocating a broad extension of the program to other gas utilities as well as programspecific features eg leveraging our weather derivative products If there is interest I would be happy to arrange a meeting with him And given Dominions interest we may wish to be in contact East Ohio Gas

Move Schedule Cc Spst My move has been scheduled as follows Load in Chicago Wed May th this will be my last day in Chicago office Drive to Houston Thursday May Friday June First day in Houston office Monday June th Please let me know if anyone needs anything or if you have any questions thanks Russell Murrell

MGU data request Cc the initial data request to be sent to MGU this week This list is intended to cover the basic information we need for modelling purposes and to get our arms around a preliminary valuation The more detailed and proprietary questions will come later when we feel more comfortable with the confidentiality of this process If anyone has any additions let me know ASAP This list might help with the SEMCO RFP as well thanks Russell Murrell
